action.action-desc: Mr. Landsman (for himself, Mr. Miller of Ohio, Mrs. Sykes, and Mr. Carey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize law enforcement agencies to use COPS grants to recruit and retain law enforcement officers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enhancing COPS Hiring Program Grants for Local Law Enforcement Act.

section.header: Use of public safety and community policing grants

subsection.text: Section 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (34 U.S.C. 10381) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding before the semicolon the following or to provide bonuses for the recruitment and retention of law enforcement officers or career law enforcement officers; and
in paragraph (2), by adding before the semicolon the following or to provide bonuses for the recruitment and retention of law enforcement officers or career law enforcement officers; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: In awarding a grant under this part, the Attorney General may permit an applicant for such a grant to amend a submitted application in lieu of creating a new application, for consideration for funding for up to five subsequent years after the original application was submitted for consideration for funding if such applicant was not awarded funding.
Section 1709 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (34 U.S.C. 10389) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: law enforcement officer shall have the meaning given such term in section 1204(9).
submitted application means an application submitted for a grant awarded pursuant to paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 1701(b).
